article: The child in the hospital bed was just waking up after having a throat operation. His throat _ ,and he was afraid .However ,the young nurse _ by his bed smiled so _ that the little boy smiled back .He _ to be afraid .The young nurse was May Paxton _ she was deaf .May Paxton graduated _ the Missouri School for the Deaf near the year 1909 .Three years _ she went to see Dr.prefix = st1 /Richardsonabout _ a nurse . Dr. Richardson was one of the founders of Mercy Hospital of Kansas City. _ had never heard of a deaf nurse .She told May that her _ would be very low and that the work would be _ .However ,May said that hard work did not frighten her .Dr. Richardson was angry with her ,and accepted May as a student nurse.  Dr. Richardson never liked her decision . In public ,she was so pleased with May's work that she later accepted two other deaf women as student nurses .The _ was Miss Marian Finch ,who was hard of _ .The second was Miss Lillie Bessie .These three were _ "the silent angles of Mercy Hospital" during the _ they worked there.  Dr. Richardson often spoke of her faith in the girls' ability to learn nursing .She wrote to May. "For three years ,you have been with us... It is wonderful to me that no man, _ or child ever ,to my knowledge ,made a complaint against you..."
